p: Achyranthes aspera locally known as “Telegne” is traditionally used in Ethiopia for treatment of a range of wound infections [ 25]. It was reported to have anti-bacterial, anti-inflammatory, analgesic, and antipyretic activities [ 26]. Previous studies on methanol extracts of A. aspera (leaves) showed secondary metabolites such as alkaloids, terpenoids, phenols and tannins which might be responsible for the pharmacological activities of the plant extract [ 27].
